author: Justin Hawkins Rides Again
description:
Making a living from music is getting harder with shrinking revenues and mounting costs. Even for bands with multiple studio albums and an established fanbase, it's hard. This week I'm speaking to David Brewis from one of my personal favourites; Field Music. He explains how a side-project  resulted in a backlash from some fans. So do we just quit? (Short answer: No) And does original music still matter? 

To see more from Field Music: https://www.youtube.com/@UClB8AtMk5oDwIz0tBQRhZjQ 
To listen to my Field Music playlist on Spotify: https://open.spotify.com/playlist/1zeMcNwonGBq7JEIi69HC1?si=NL7lHpJJTtCyjgjsxBA-7g
For my review of Field Music highlights: https://youtu.be/99ofzrMDS6s?si=J1A0NVmPuMYNTrH4

To come and see Justin Hawkins Rides Again LIVE across the UK in January and February, find tickets here: 
https://www.aegpresents.co.uk/event/justin-hawkins-rides-again/

To see more from me and JHRA,  join my Patreon here: http://www.patreon.com/jushawk

For Cameo messages: https://w
title: Albums, Fans & Recognition but Is That Enough in 2025?
